title: The Face of Evil
dialogue_triumphs: 'Would you like a jelly baby?' 'It's true then. They say the Evil One eats babies.'
'The very powerful and the very stupid have one thing in common. They don't alter their views to fit the facts, they alter the facts to fit their views.'
Neeva: 'We start getting proof and we stop believing.' Tomas: 'With proof, you don't have to believe.'
goofs: Leela can't pronounce Calib's name on film ('Callib') but can in the studio ('Kaye-lib').
She kills a Tesh guard, who throws his gun down the corridor. In the next shot, she picks it up from beside him.
Why do the invisible energy 'creatures' leave footprints?

continuity_notes.current_status: Trying to reach Hyde Park, carrying a clockwork egg-timer.

continuity_notes.current_status: Uses janis thorns which paralyse, then kill.

continuity_notes.description: A computer with multiple personalities, including the Doctor's.
continuity_notes.current_status: Functioning as a god-like entity for the colony.

Night of the Demon (the immobile monster)

locations.name: Unnamed Earth colony
locations.description: The setting of the story, divided between the Sevateem and Tesh.
locations.current_status: Many centuries after the Mordee Expedition.

future_history: The Mordee Expedition, possibly a future human ethnic group or spaceship, colonized this planet. The colony split into two groups: the Sevateem (who left the 'Place of Land') and the Tesh (who remained).
untold_adventures: The Doctor's first visit to the planet, where he used Sidelian memory transfer to reprogram the Mordee computer.
The Doctor claims to have been taught the crossbow by William Tell.
additional_notes: Neeva wears a cricket glove on his head, which is noted as a 'Fashion Victim' moment.
bottom_line: A little masterpiece, often undeservedly forgotten by the weight of the surrounding stories. A magnificent cast shake every ounce of subtlety and invention from the script. Pity they didn't use the working title 'The Day God Went Mad', however, as it fits wonderfully well.
